subject: Sexual Health
title: The Brain During Puberty
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Brain During Puberty.

hook.text: The teenage brain undergoes massive remodeling, pruning unused connections and strengthening important ones.

buildup.text: Synaptic pruning eliminates weak neural connections while myelination speeds up the remaining pathways.

discovery.text: The brain remodels from back to front. The last area to mature is the prefrontal cortex, which governs judgment.

twist.text: This explains why teens ace math but still make impulsive choices. Brain regions mature at different rates.

climax.text: The teen brain is not broken. It is under construction, building a more efficient adult brain piece by piece.

punchline.text: Under construction until 25. Powerful but incomplete.

quiz.question: What is the last brain area to fully mature?
